text: High propensity voters are contacted. Low propensity voters aren’t. The average Latino voter is 29. They’re young & haven’t formed a history of voting. As a result, they rarely receive a touch. Given that young voters will be largest generation of voters, parties need to catch-up
author: MariaTeresa1

text: 68% of Latinas are pro-choice, across generations. Head over to our great partner to learn more: @NLIRH
author: MariaTeresa1

text: I’ve thought about this for a bit.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: We leave interested, persuadable voters on the table each cycle bc there is little strategic investment in Latinx due to misperception, lack of culturally competency by parties. There will be 4m new voters by 2020. Work needs to start now, continuous, and not at the last minute.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: Pew calculates total eligible voters 27m & actual voters (12.7m). They miss the critical link: how many are REGISTERED & vote. There are 16m registered voters of which about 80% voted in last election. 11m left unregistered. Job is to register bc when registered, Latinx vote.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: Or they can do their actual job and focus on inclusive policies instead of fighting the future. That future is here.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: In 2016, 27m Latinx were eligible to vote. 16m were reigistered, 80% of whom voted. Today there are 29m eligible- we aren’t meeting the need fast enough. Midterms do have less participation for every demo but in TX Latino early vote is up 200% from 2014.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: It’s a generational debate within the community. Those under 25 are increasingly identifying as Latinx - it encompasses spectrum of gender identity. No person from Latin America identifies as Latino until they live in US. Language changes, adapts.

 Caravan

lying that he has authority to end birthright citizenship

text: This is a lie. @bpolitics shouldn’t quote President without including fact check. 30 countries guarantee birthright citizenship. And his proposal is unconstitutional. Pointing that out would also be informative. It’s a sideshow. Election must be close. Focus on it.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: I encourage news outlets to focus on what’s on the ballot: healthcare, healthcare, healthcare. GOP incumbents who ran on eliminating the ACÁ and now claim they care about pre-existing conditions. Or gun safety, choice, family separation. Focus on voter suppression. That’s helpful
author: MariaTeresa1

text: Another sideshow: President peddling meddling w the Constitution which guarantees birthright citizenship. He can’t. 30 countries guarantee it too. Red meat for his base. Notion makes us less secure by creating a permanent underclass. Been there, done that. Stay focused - vote.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: We must remember it’s a minority in our country. It’s time we correct the course. We need to out vote them. And we need to bring our friends. Our kids depend on us. And hugs to you! Your son is so lucky.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: My toddlers are of Afro-Latinx, South Asian & Jewish descent. In other words, they’re American. Weekend’s event, kids in cages it’s personal for me as it should be for each of us. We can’t let a few dictate our future w fear. Rather, we must rise w fierce love. It starts w voting

text: Recently, a consultant told me he didn’t know what we do. Our name is @VotoLatino. Texas is what we do & how we do it: register, empower Latinos. We don’t leave a voter on the table thanks to you.  Help us crush it in 2018! Donate here:
author: MariaTeresa1

text: In 2016, we registered a record 39k, 77% who voted & were disproportionately 1st time TX voters. This primary in El Paso we ran a pilot w 2 college chapters, registered over 700 new voters in 2 weeks & contacted over 16k voters under 35. We worked our hearts out thx to you.
author: MariaTeresa1

text: TX made us proud! @votolatino started work there since 2010 bc we saw record of young Latinos coming of age. We’ve been there despite establishment consultants saying we were wasting our time & telling donors not to fund us. Our small donors- you made this possible!
